View Document NBA Recognition View Document (2020-23) View Document (2023-26) View Document (2026-28) REFUND/CANCELLATION POLICY Fee refund norms against cancellation of admissions: For cancellation of admission, the issue of refund of tuition fee to student shall be decided in the light of MHRD circular, UGC norms (UGC regulations 2016, 6.2) and University policy.
The broad rules for refund of tution fee against cancellation of seat are: Admission fee is non-refundable, once student is provisionally admitted.
Tuition fee paid will be refunded if the student cancel his /her admission before the commencement of class work.
Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

Vision of IQAC The vision of the Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC) is to foster a culture of continuous improvement and excellence in all aspects of Vignan’s Foundation for Science, Technology & Research functioning.

Vision statement for an IQAC: "To establish a dynamic and sustainable system for continuous quality enhancement that ensures the holistic development of the institution, nurtures academic excellence, fosters innovation, and upholds the highest standards of integrity, transparency, and accountability in all processes." Key Aspects of the Vision: Continuous Improvement: The IQAC envisions an institution that consistently evolves and improves its educational processes, teaching methods, infrastructure, and overall organizational culture.

Collaboration and Engagement: Creating a strong network of students, faculty, alumni, and industry stakeholders to ensure that the institution remains responsive to both academic and professional needs Transparency and Accountability: Ensuring that all processes, from admissions to assessments, are transparent, fair, and accountable, with clear communication and feedback mechanisms.

The broad rules for refund of tution fee against cancellation of seat are: Admission fee is non-refundable, once student is provisionally admitted.
Tuition fee paid will be refunded if the student cancel his /her admission before the commencement of class work.
Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

THE FACULTY INDUSTRY IMMERSION PROGRAMME (FIIP) A new initiative that bridges industry academia gap Program Overview About the Program The Faculty Industry Immersion Program (FIIP) is a flagship initiative of VFSTR designed to enable faculty members to immerse themselves in real-time industrial environments for a defined duration.

AP Space summit-2026 Vignan University విజ్ఞాన్ శాస్త్ర సాంకేతిక పరిశోధనా సంస్థ / विग्नान शास्त्र प्रौद्योगिकी और परिशोधन संगठन International Students New Student Parent Alumni Admissions FIIP Quick links Hyd (Off Campus) Vignan Online Webmail IQAC AR Complaint form Contact Us Home Objectives Thematic Area Events FAQs Visitor Pass Contact HYD Campus International Students New Student Parent Alumni FIIP Webmail News ANDHRA PRADESH SPACE TECH SUMMIT 2026 on 22 – 24ᵗʰ January 2026 at VFSTR, Vadlamudi, Guntur, Andhra Pradesh Theme: Leveraging Space Technology For Viksit Bharat 2047Showcasing space applications from Students, Startups, Research Institutes and Companies.

Jointly Organized by Vignan’s Foundation for Science, Technology & Research (VFSTR), Guntur www.vignan.ac.in Andhra Pradesh SpaceTech Academy (APSA) https: //apspace.org Andhra Pradesh SpaceTech Summit-2026 The vision of the Indian Space Programme, initiated in the 1960s, is to harness space technology for national development, while pursuing space science research and planetary exploration.
As the annual flagship event of APSA, the Summit drives collaboration and innovation, supporting the vision of Swarna Andhra and the national mission Vikshit Bharat 2047.

APSA is the first State-level SpaceTech Academy in Andhra Pradesh, founded with a vision to advance space sciences and nurture the next generation of scientists, engineers, and entrepreneurs—driving the State towards Swarna Andhra Pradesh and an Viksit Bharat, 2047.

VISION To establish Andhra Pradesh as a hub of excellence in space science and technology, nurturing skilled talent, fostering innovation, and driving sustainable growth— paving the way for a self-reliant and globally competitive SpaceTech ecosystem that contributes to the realization of Swarna Andhra Pradesh and Viksit Bharat 2047.

MISSION To empower and inspire the next generation of space professionals through hands- on education and training in space sciences, engineering, and applications; To foster innovation and entrepreneurship for the emerging global space economy.

Srinivasa RaoDean, P&C, VFSTR, Guntur OBJECTIVES Aligned with the overarching vision of Viksit Bharat 2047, these objectives articulate Andhra Pradesh’s strategic roadmap for fostering innovation, strengthening space capabilities, and delivering sustainable societal impact through the effective use of space technologies.
Future of Humanity in Space:Discuss interplanetary missions, space habitats, and long-term human presence in space.

THEMATIC AREAS Core Space Engineering & Technologies - Engineering the Future This track focuses on the cutting-edge technologies that power modern space missions, from launch systems to advanced satellite engineering.
Ground stations and associated software, Data centres for space data mission operations & infrastructure readiness.
Space Science & Exploration – Expanding Horizons This track delves into humanity’s quest to explore the universe, advance scientific discovery, and prepare for future interplanetary missions.
Ground systems, mission operations & infrastructure readiness.
Life Sciences and Space Biology Astrobiology Bioastronautics Space Medicine Space Bioprocess Engineering Mission critical computer system Navigation, guidance and control.

This aspect would also include deriving perverted pleasure, vicarious or sadistic thrill from actively or passively participating in the discomfiture to others; the absence of preparing 'freshers' in the run up to their admission to higher education and life in hostels also can be ascribed as a psychological aspect of ragging - coping skills in interaction with seniors or strangers can be imparted by parents as well.
The students who are found to be indulged in ragging should be debarred from taking admission in any technical institution in India.

Cancellation of admission Suspension from attending classes Withholding/withdrawing scholarship/fellowship and other benefits Debarring from appearing in any test/examination or other evaluation process Withholding results Debarring from representing the institution in any regional, national or international meet, tournament, youth festival, etc.

Suspension/expulsion from the hostel Rustication from the institution for period ranging from 1 to 4 semesters Expulsion from the institution and consequent debarring from admission to any other institution.

The broad rules for refund of tution fee against cancellation of seat are: Admission fee is non-refundable, once student is provisionally admitted.
Tuition fee paid will be refunded if the student cancel his /her admission before the commencement of class work.
Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

Key policies include: Policies Maintenance Policy Ensures the upkeep and regular maintenance of the university’s infrastructure and facilities, promoting a safe and functional campus environment Download Research Policy Encourages and supports research activities through guidelines that ensure ethical practices, funding utilization, and the dissemination of research findings Download Industrial Training Policy Provides a framework for student internships and industrial training programs, enhancing practical learning and industry readiness Download Financial Policy Defines the management of financial resources, including budgeting, expenditure, and audits, ensuring fiscal responsibility Download Resource Mobilisation Policy Focuses on strategies to secure and optimize resources to support the university’s strategic goals and programs Download Environment & Sustainability Policy Reflects the university’s commitment to environmental responsibility and sustainable practices across campus activities Download Gender Equity Policy Ensures gender fairness in all university activities, promoting an inclusive and supportive atmosphere for all members Download IT Policy Establishes guidelines for the appropriate use, security, and management of the university’s IT resources, ensuring efficient and secure digital operations Download COVID19 Policy Document Provides guidelines for maintaining health and safety during pandemics, outlining protocols to minimize risk and ensure continuity of education Download Admission Policy Defines transparent and merit-based criteria for student admissions, supporting an inclusive and competitive process that aligns with academic standards Download Ending Poverty Applies to all Vignan University units, covering local, regional, national, and international activities and collaborations.

View Document NBA Recognition View Document (2020-23) View Document (2023-26) View Document (2026-28) REFUND/CANCELLATION POLICY Fee refund norms against cancellation of admissions: For cancellation of admission, the issue of refund of tuition fee to student shall be decided in the light of MHRD circular, UGC norms (UGC regulations 2016, 6.2) and University policy.
The broad rules for refund of tution fee against cancellation of seat are: Admission fee is non-refundable, once student is provisionally admitted.
Tuition fee paid will be refunded if the student cancel his /her admission before the commencement of class work.
Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

Eligibility Criteria Eligibility for UG Program Candidates born on or after 1st July, 2005 and a pass in Intermediate or its equivalent with minimum 60% aggregate marks are eligible to appear for the admission test.
Candidates qualified in AP or TS EAMCET / JEE(Mains) / JEE(Advanced) with a minimum 60% aggregate marks in the +2 / Intermediate examinations are also eligible for admission.
For such candidates, a faculty mentor is allocated to the candidate after he/she is given a provisional admission.
Mentor could become a Research Supervisor for the Ph.D program after confirmation of Ph.D admission at VFSTR.

The Master’s Project of the candidate must be in line with the proposed research topic for Ph.D and he/she needs to present a detailed comprehensive literature review to the Doctoral Committee within one year of provisional admission, however candidate is required to hold a Master’s degree in Engineering / Technology with a minimum of 60% or equivalent CGPA before being formally admitted into Ph.D program.

The broad rules for refund of tution fee against cancellation of seat are: Admission fee is non-refundable, once student is provisionally admitted.
Tuition fee paid will be refunded if the student cancel his /her admission before the commencement of class work.
Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

Graduates from ABET-accredited programs benefit from global recognition of their degrees, enhanced employability, and opportunities for high-profile careers and advanced studies at leading organisations worldwide.

The five accredited programs are: Computer Science and Engineering: This program focuses on the principles of computing, programming languages, algorithm design, and software development.
Biotechnology: This program combines biology with technology, focusing on the use of living systems and organisms to develop or make products.
ABET accreditation is a prestigious global recognition that assures a program meets the quality standards of the profession for which it prepares its students.

Achieving this accreditation involves a rigorous evaluation process, including an assessment of curriculum, faculty qualifications, facilities, and institutional support, ensuring that the programs meet international standards of quality and excellence.

The accreditation process at VFSTR involved a thorough evaluation conducted by a 10-member team from the United States, who spent three days meticulously assessing the university’s academic programs, faculty qualifications, infrastructure, and overall institutional effectiveness.

He stated that this accreditation will open doors for students to pursue higher education and employment opportunities abroad, participate in international training programs, exchange initiatives, and collaboration agreements with leading foreign universities.

THE FACULTY INDUSTRY IMMERSION PROGRAMME (FIIP) A new initiative that bridges industry academia gap Program Overview About the Program The Faculty Industry Immersion Program (FIIP) is a flagship initiative of VFSTR designed to enable faculty members to immerse themselves in real-time industrial environments for a defined duration.

The program empowers faculty with practical exposure to cutting-edge technologies, tools, and industry best practices, while fostering stronger collaborations with industry for research, innovation, and curriculum development.
Program Objectives Strengthening Collaboration Build and sustain partnerships between academia and industry for joint research, innovation, and product development.
Industry-Academia Partnerships Mobility Programs with mutually beneficial partnerships.

Research and Academic Outcomes Research Institutions Strengthening Interdisciplinary Research Collaborations The program promotes active collaboration among faculty across science, agriculture, and technology disciplines, enabling integrated solutions to complex real-world problems through joint research efforts.

Cultivating Advanced Research Methodologies The program introduces faculty to modern research designs, simulation models, data analytics, and experimental frameworks that improve scientific rigor, accuracy, and scalability in their research work.

Explored Long-Term Collaboration for Joint Research and Student Internship Programs Industries and Institute build long-term partnerships enabling collaborative research and structured student internships.

The training ensures development of skills such as: Critical thinking and problem solving Collaboration Agility and adaptability Initiative and entrepreneurialism Effective oral and written communication Accessing and analysing information Curiosity and imagination Understanding importance of the soft skills at global work place and to bridge the skill gap between the industry requirements and academics; Vignans' Training Cell has designed a crash training course for the B.Tech 2nd year students.
As a part of this, special care is taken in conducting various training programs for students to enhance their capability.

The training programs are as follows: TECHNICAL ENGLISH COMMUNICATION (TEC) This program focuses majorly on improving the basic vocabulary that is required for a student to participate actively in the classroom discussions.

ENGLISH PROFICIENCY & COMMUNICATION SKILLS (EPCS) The objective of this program is to introduce the specific uses of English to students and to improve the language proficiency of students in communicating the meaning verbally, as well as writing.
In this programme, all applicants must be able to demonstrate that they have the English proficiency required for their individual program.
Preliminary English Test (PET) is one of such Cambridge English Qualifications for which students are provided with an opportunity to attend through this program.

Here in vignan, SAC aids in providing meaningful and enjoyable, social, cultural and educational programs and events that appeal and are accessible to the widest group of students possible, both on and off campus.

The broad rules for refund of tution fee against cancellation of seat are: Admission fee is non-refundable, once student is provisionally admitted.
Tuition fee paid will be refunded if the student cancel his /her admission before the commencement of class work.
Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

The broad rules for refund of tution fee against cancellation of seat are: Admission fee is non-refundable, once student is provisionally admitted.
Tuition fee paid will be refunded if the student cancel his /her admission before the commencement of class work.
Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

This aspect would also include deriving perverted pleasure, vicarious or sadistic thrill from actively or passively participating in the discomfiture to others; the absence of preparing 'freshers' in the run up to their admission to higher education and life in hostels also can be ascribed as a psychological aspect of ragging - coping skills in interaction with seniors or strangers can be imparted by parents as well.
The students who are found to be indulged in ragging should be debarred from taking admission in any technical institution in India.

Cancellation of admission Suspension from attending classes Withholding/withdrawing scholarship/fellowship and other benefits Debarring from appearing in any test/examination or other evaluation process Withholding results Debarring from representing the institution in any regional, national or international meet, tournament, youth festival, etc.

Suspension/expulsion from the hostel Rustication from the institution for period ranging from 1 to 4 semesters Expulsion from the institution and consequent debarring from admission to any other institution.

The broad rules for refund of tution fee against cancellation of seat are: Admission fee is non-refundable, once student is provisionally admitted.
Tuition fee paid will be refunded if the student cancel his /her admission before the commencement of class work.
Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

Key policies include: Policies Maintenance Policy Ensures the upkeep and regular maintenance of the university’s infrastructure and facilities, promoting a safe and functional campus environment Download Research Policy Encourages and supports research activities through guidelines that ensure ethical practices, funding utilization, and the dissemination of research findings Download Industrial Training Policy Provides a framework for student internships and industrial training programs, enhancing practical learning and industry readiness Download Financial Policy Defines the management of financial resources, including budgeting, expenditure, and audits, ensuring fiscal responsibility Download Resource Mobilisation Policy Focuses on strategies to secure and optimize resources to support the university’s strategic goals and programs Download Environment & Sustainability Policy Reflects the university’s commitment to environmental responsibility and sustainable practices across campus activities Download Gender Equity Policy Ensures gender fairness in all university activities, promoting an inclusive and supportive atmosphere for all members Download IT Policy Establishes guidelines for the appropriate use, security, and management of the university’s IT resources, ensuring efficient and secure digital operations Download COVID19 Policy Document Provides guidelines for maintaining health and safety during pandemics, outlining protocols to minimize risk and ensure continuity of education Download Admission Policy Defines transparent and merit-based criteria for student admissions, supporting an inclusive and competitive process that aligns with academic standards Download Ending Poverty Applies to all Vignan University units, covering local, regional, national, and international activities and collaborations.
Download Access and Participation Plan for Women Policy promotes gender equality (SDG5) by supporting women’s access, admission, and participation at Vignan’s University.
Download Non-Discrimination Policy for Transgender Vignan University ensures equal access for all, regardless of gender, race, caste, or religion, in admissions, employment, and participation.

Eligibility Criteria Eligibility for UG Program Candidates born on or after 1st July, 2005 and a pass in Intermediate or its equivalent with minimum 60% aggregate marks are eligible to appear for the admission test.
Candidates qualified in AP or TS EAMCET / JEE(Mains) / JEE(Advanced) with a minimum 60% aggregate marks in the +2 / Intermediate examinations are also eligible for admission.
Written Test will be conducted for Bachelor's Degree holders who have not appeared in any entrance test.
Note: Candidates appearing for qualifying examination and awaiting results can also apply.
Note: Candidates appearing for qualifying examination and awaiting results can also apply.
For such candidates, a faculty mentor is allocated to the candidate after he/she is given a provisional admission.
Mentor could become a Research Supervisor for the Ph.D program after confirmation of Ph.D admission at VFSTR.

The Master’s Project of the candidate must be in line with the proposed research topic for Ph.D and he/she needs to present a detailed comprehensive literature review to the Doctoral Committee within one year of provisional admission, however candidate is required to hold a Master’s degree in Engineering / Technology with a minimum of 60% or equivalent CGPA before being formally admitted into Ph.D program.

View Document NBA Recognition View Document (2020-23) View Document (2023-26) View Document (2026-28) REFUND/CANCELLATION POLICY Fee refund norms against cancellation of admissions: For cancellation of admission, the issue of refund of tuition fee to student shall be decided in the light of MHRD circular, UGC norms (UGC regulations 2016, 6.2) and University policy.
The broad rules for refund of tution fee against cancellation of seat are: Admission fee is non-refundable, once student is provisionally admitted.
Tuition fee paid will be refunded if the student cancel his /her admission before the commencement of class work.
Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

View Document NBA Recognition View Document (2020-23) View Document (2023-26) View Document (2026-28) REFUND/CANCELLATION POLICY Fee refund norms against cancellation of admissions: For cancellation of admission, the issue of refund of tuition fee to student shall be decided in the light of MHRD circular, UGC norms (UGC regulations 2016, 6.2) and University policy.
The broad rules for refund of tution fee against cancellation of seat are: Admission fee is non-refundable, once student is provisionally admitted.
Tuition fee paid will be refunded if the student cancel his /her admission before the commencement of class work.
Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

View Document NBA Recognition View Document (2020-23) View Document (2023-26) View Document (2026-28) REFUND/CANCELLATION POLICY Fee refund norms against cancellation of admissions: For cancellation of admission, the issue of refund of tuition fee to student shall be decided in the light of MHRD circular, UGC norms (UGC regulations 2016, 6.2) and University policy.
The broad rules for refund of tution fee against cancellation of seat are: Admission fee is non-refundable, once student is provisionally admitted.
Tuition fee paid will be refunded if the student cancel his /her admission before the commencement of class work.
Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

Privacy Policy IQAC Functions Development and application of quality benchmarks/ parameters for various academic and administrative activities of the institution Facilitating the creation of a learner-centric environment conducive to quality education and faculty maturation to adopt the required knowledge and technology for participatory teaching and learning process Arrangement for feedback response from students, parents and other stakeholders on quality-related institutional processes Dissemination of information on various quality parameters of higher education Organisation of inter and intra institutional workshops, seminars on quality related themes and promotion of quality circles Documentation of the various programmes/activities leading to quality improvement Acting as a nodal agency of the Institution for coordinating quality-related activities, including adoption and dissemination of best practices Development and maintenance of institutional database through MIS for the purpose of maintaining/enhancing the institutional quality Development of Quality Culture in the institution Preparation of the Annual Quality Assurance Report (AQAR) as per guidelines and parameters of NAAC, to be submitted to NAAC Dean Message It is with great pride and enthusiasm that I extend my warm greetings to all members of our academic community.
The IQAC plays a critical role in fostering a culture of quality through consistent self-assessment, constructive feedback, and the implementation of innovative strategies.

Collaboration and Engagement: Creating a strong network of students, faculty, alumni, and industry stakeholders to ensure that the institution remains responsive to both academic and professional needs Transparency and Accountability: Ensuring that all processes, from admissions to assessments, are transparent, fair, and accountable, with clear communication and feedback mechanisms.
Implement mechanisms for feedback collection from students, faculty, and other stakeholders to identify areas for improvement.
Implement student feedback systems and ensure prompt action on grievances to enhance student satisfaction.
To Maintain Documentation and Reporting Systems Ensure comprehensive documentation of quality-related activities, reports, and feedback for future reference.

Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

Prior to closing of admissions and after commencement of class work, tuition fee is refundable with proportionate deduction of monthly fee.
Once admissions are closed, the entire fee collected shall be forfeited.

Cultivating Advanced Research Methodologies The program introduces faculty to modern research designs, simulation models, data analytics, and experimental frameworks that improve scientific rigor, accuracy, and scalability in their research work.

Key policies include: Policies Maintenance Policy Ensures the upkeep and regular maintenance of the university’s infrastructure and facilities, promoting a safe and functional campus environment Download Research Policy Encourages and supports research activities through guidelines that ensure ethical practices, funding utilization, and the dissemination of research findings Download Industrial Training Policy Provides a framework for student internships and industrial training programs, enhancing practical learning and industry readiness Download Financial Policy Defines the management of financial resources, including budgeting, expenditure, and audits, ensuring fiscal responsibility Download Resource Mobilisation Policy Focuses on strategies to secure and optimize resources to support the university’s strategic goals and programs Download Environment & Sustainability Policy Reflects the university’s commitment to environmental responsibility and sustainable practices across campus activities Download Gender Equity Policy Ensures gender fairness in all university activities, promoting an inclusive and supportive atmosphere for all members Download IT Policy Establishes guidelines for the appropriate use, security, and management of the university’s IT resources, ensuring efficient and secure digital operations Download COVID19 Policy Document Provides guidelines for maintaining health and safety during pandemics, outlining protocols to minimize risk and ensure continuity of education Download Admission Policy Defines transparent and merit-based criteria for student admissions, supporting an inclusive and competitive process that aligns with academic standards Download Ending Poverty Applies to all Vignan University units, covering local, regional, national, and international activities and collaborations.

Download Reservation Policy Guarantees equitable access to education for all sections of society, ensuring compliance with government regulations and promoting diversity Download E-Governance Policy Promotes the use of technology to enhance administrative efficiency, transparency, and responsiveness in university governance Download Consultancy Policy Outlines procedures for faculty and departments to engage in consultancy work, promoting industry collaboration and knowledge transfer Download Scholarships Policy Provides a comprehensive approach to awarding scholarships, ensuring financial assistance to deserving and meritorious students Download Student Grievance redressal Policy Ensures students have access to a fair and transparent system for addressing their concerns and complaints Download Divyangjan Policy Addresses the needs of students and staff with disabilities, ensuring accessibility and inclusivity throughout the university facilities and programs Download These policies collectively demonstrate Vignan University’s commitment to maintaining high standards, fostering inclusivity, promoting sustainability, and supporting the holistic development of its community Handbooks Hand Books Download Code of Conduct for Students Download Code of Conduct for Faculty Download Contact Us Vignan's Foundation for Science, Technology and Research (Deemed to be University), Vadlamudi, Guntur-522213 info@vignan.ac.in 0863-2344700 / 701 Vignan’s Foundation for Science, Technology, and Research (Vignan) met the accreditation requirements of the International Accreditation Organization (IAO) and was granted full accreditation.

Machine Tools Research Center Composites lab Research Center Bio-Fuel Preparation & Testing Research Center Mobile Robotics Lab Machine Tools Research Centers: It focus on developing cutting-edge machinery and techniques to enhance precision, efficiency, and innovation in manufacturing processes.

Composites Lab Research Centers: It focus on developing innovative composite materials to enhance performance, durability, and sustainability across industries like aerospace, automotive, and construction.

Mobile Robotics Labs: It focus on designing intelligent, autonomous systems to navigate and perform tasks in dynamic environments, revolutionizing applications in industries like logistics and exploration.
Renewable Energy Dr.C.R.Rao Research Center Structural Engineering Renewable Energy Laboratory: It focuses on developing sustainable energy solutions for agriculture.
Structural Engineering Research Laboratory: It is a specialized facility dedicated to the study and testing of structural materials, components, and systems.
It also seeks to establish sustainable collaborations with government, academia, and industry at national and international levels to enhance entrepreneurial success.

Composites Lab Research Centers: It focus on developing innovative composite materials to enhance performance, durability, and sustainability across industries like aerospace, automotive, and construction.

Mobile Robotics Labs: It focus on designing intelligent, autonomous systems to navigate and perform tasks in dynamic environments, revolutionizing applications in industries like logistics and exploration.
Renewable Energy Dr.C.R.Rao Research Center Structural Engineering Renewable Energy Laboratory: It focuses on developing sustainable energy solutions for agriculture.
Structural Engineering Research Laboratory: It is a specialized facility dedicated to the study and testing of structural materials, components, and systems.

VFSTR is dedicated to upholding high ethical norms and principles, ensuring the development of professionals with excellent ethical judgment, social integration, and leadership skills.We are committed to outlawing, preventing, and eradicating ragging.

Ragging adversely impacts the standards of higher education Raghavan Committee Ragging at its most harmless is embarrassing and silly, but at its worst, it attempts to prevent individual students from independent thinking, attempts, in fact, to eradicate freewill Debalina Haldar, The Female Ward University Committee View All Dr.

Hemanth babu Student Member, III-MECH (8885476252) National Anti-Ragging Programme The Centre for Youth (C4Y) is working as a monitoring agency in association with the Ministry of Education, Government of India, and the University Grant Commission (UGC), to support the National Ragging Prevention Programme in the country.

37-3/Legal/AICTE/2009 dated 25-03-2009 has taken a very serious view of ragging incidences in educational institutions and on Directions of the Hon'ble Supreme Court of India vide its Order dated 16.5.2007 has ordered strict implementation of following rules & regulations for Prevention and prohibition of Ragging in technical Institutions.

Any act that prevents, disrupts or disturbs the regular academic activity of a student should be considered with in the academics related aspect of ragging; similarly, exploiting the services of a junior student for completing the academic tasks assigned to an individual or a group of seniors is also an aspect of academics related ragging prevalent in many institutions, particularly in the technical institutions.

Sports Amenities The campus features extensive outdoor sports facilities, including cricket, football, volleyball, tennis, basketball, and a 400-meter athletics track.
Additionally, an indoor sports facility provides resources for indoor games such as table tennis and badminton.

It has a President, Vice Presidents, General Secretaries, Member Secretaries and a Treasurer, supported by a sub-structure of various committees, who plan, organize and execute a plethora of Co and Extracurricular events and competitions on campus.

Here in vignan, SAC aids in providing meaningful and enjoyable, social, cultural and educational programs and events that appeal and are accessible to the widest group of students possible, both on and off campus.

Planning and Execution of Institution clubs: The best way to ever experience the vast spectrum of activities would be to join the various clubs .These clubs will help students to meet other enthusiasts and experts inthe fields and thus create the perfect learning environment, making the clubs a hugebank of collective knowledge which is passed from one batch to another.
There are 13 optional clubs categorized into four major groups such as cultural, Literary, fine arts and Innovators club which are overseen by the Student ActivitiesCouncil of the institution.
In addition to the conduction of club activities various events will be planned by the Student Activities council.

On this regard an activity calendar of all the training activities organized under clubs and other activities will be interspersed by the Student Activities Council and it ensures their execution as per the schedule.

Read More Sports & Culturals The institution provides rich scope and facilities for different clubs like literary, cultural, sports and fine arts.

These clubs offer a platform for students to exhibit their innate and latent talents in the areas of their interest.For facilitating students to conduct and participate in the wide spectrum of recreational activities,the institution has well planned infrastructure.

Open-air Theatres: Two spacious open-air theatres are available with a capacity of 1500 to 2000 students for the use of different co-curricular and extra curricular activities as well as to conduct mega events like Vignan Mahostav (A National Level Youth Festival).
Seminar Halls: State of the art Seminar and Gallery halls in both the Visweswaraiah and Aryabhatta blocks give scope for conduction of Intra- Departmental literary, cultural events.
Sports Facilities: The campus is equipped with facilities for all outdoor games like cricket, football, volleyball, tennis, basketball, and a 400-meter track athletics.
An Indoor Sports Complex offers provision for indoor games like table tennis, badminton etc.

To keep the students motivated,the physical educational department under the supervision of a well qualified Physical Director conducts intramurals round the year for keeping the sports persons well practiced and ready to participate whenever, there is a state level or national level event.
